resources.string: No location detected. Make sure location is enabled on the device.
GPS Client helps you send Location and Custom Information to a Server or URL of your choice as a JSON payload.
The Geo Tab displays the most recent Latitude and Longitude values.

The Vehicle Tab helps you save your custom information in fields vehicle name, driver name, Parameter 1 and Parameter 2.
Clicking Save, will store the data on your mobile.

string.name: help_settings_text
string.p: The Settings Tab helps you configure your http endpoint(server URL) and a polling interval.

p.br: Polling Interval is in milliseconds, so setting 30,000 would equate to GPS position accessed every 30 seconds and sent to the http endpoint.

string.p: Clicking Save will store these fields on your mobile.

string.name: help_schedule_text
string.p: Once the http end point and polling interval are configured and saved click Schedule Job. The job runs in the background Job and sends location + Custom Information from Vehicle tab to the http endpoint periodically for the pre-configured (polling interval) seconds.
You can close the app at this point and the job will run in the background.

string.name: help_cancel_text
string.p: To cancel the scheduled/background job, open the app and click Cancel Job under settings tab.

p.br: Your Data is sent to the http/https endpoint as a POST request with a JSON Body

string.name: help_server_text
string.p: It is upto the user to setup the http endpoint/url to receive location date. A simple nodejs code on how to receive the data is demonstrated.

p.br: KULU does not store any of the user or location data. KULU holds no responsibility or liability on loss or damage incurred by its usage.
